title: [UWP+Android] wildly alternating touch co-ordinates

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: I tried to reproduce this, but was not able to. Is it possible to create a simple repro case?

comments.author: deakjahn
comments.body: Dunno. I had an image crop rectangle control that showed this. In the meantime, I replaced it with a more elegant version bases mostly on Petzold's article on MSDN (although expanded to cover more functionality) and there is no problem with that now. I could send you the control but, frankly, I don't know how interwoven it is with the rest of my app, whether it's easy to run it separately or not.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: DId you ever get more info on this issue? I was not able to repro and you did say it may be mixed in with the app code.

comments.author: deakjahn
comments.body: Probably not. Might have been something deeper in XF. As I mentioned, my current code doesn't show any such problems but even that older one linked didn't do any fancy stuff, just logged directly what came from the system. So, I suspect the fault was with the system, not my code that was and still is very straightforward. Let's allow this to sink to the bottom.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: OK. I'll close this and if you (or anyone in the community) notices this, either reopen or create a new issue.
